column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mrs.
#Text=Miturumbwe (spoke in French): I would\r
#Text=like to say how pleased I am to be here today to tell the\r
#Text=Security Council and the international community in\r
#Text=general about the concerns and expectations of the\r
#Text=women of Burundi in the context of the\r
#Text=implementation of resolution 1325 (2000).
#Text=I would also like to express my gratitude to the\r
#Text=United Nations system as a whole for its efforts to help\r
#Text=Burundian women throughout the reconciliation\r
#Text=process.
#Text=Burundi has just emerged from a war that lasted\r
#Text=more than 10 years and caused a great deal of harm in\r
#Text=both human and material terms.
#Text=Very recently, in\r
#Text=September, the Government and the Forces nationales\r
#Text=de liberation-Parti pour la liberation du peuple hutu\r
#Text=(FNL-PALIPEHUTU) signed a ceasefire agreement.
#Text=Burundian men and women have welcomed that step\r
#Text=but remain convinced that sustained efforts must\r
#Text=2\r
#Text=continue with a view to overcoming the many\r
#Text=challenges of the peacebuilding period.
#Text=Burundian women, who have committed\r
#Text=themselves to the quest for peace since independence\r
#Text=in 1961, continue to work to mobilize and to heighten\r
#Text=awareness of the need for better representation\r
#Text=throughout the decision-making process so as to ensure\r
#Text=that their rights are an integral part of negotiations.
#Text=The\r
#Text=right of succession, which would guarantee women the\r
#Text=right to land and thus provide for their economic\r
#Text=security, was among the important issues considered\r
#Text=during the Arusha process.
#Text=Despite progress at the\r
#Text=national level, we have to admit that our Constitution\r
#Text=and the Electoral Code say nothing about the proper\r
#Text=level of representation at the grassroots level.
#Text=In fact,\r
#Text=the national gender policy lacks resources to\r
#Text=implement the principles of equality at the national\r
#Text=level.
#Text=Burundian women have been active since the\r
#Text=peace talks, and the details of those activities can be\r
#Text=found in the documents distributed to you.
#Text=There have\r
#Text=been consultations among women at the national level\r
#Text=in the context of implementing resolution 1325 (2000),\r
#Text=and the recommendations of those consultations can be\r
#Text=summed up as follows.
#Text=Concerning good governance and democracy, it is\r
#Text=important to ensure constant dialogue between the\r
#Text=Government, the political parties and the media.
#Text=In this\r
#Text=dialogue, general interest should take precedence over\r
#Text=individual interest.
#Text=For good, transparent and inclusive\r
#Text=governance, it is important not only to ensure\r
#Text=cooperation and dialogue at all levels, down to the\r
#Text=local level, but also to include all social groups,\r
#Text=especially women.
#Text=In this connection, it should be\r
#Text=noted that the principle of a 30-per-cent quota is\r
#Text=applied only for a limited portion of the population and\r
#Text=is not reflected at the grassroots level.
#Text=Furthermore,\r
#Text=this quota should be 50 per cent.
#Text=We recommend that the international community\r
#Text=continue to lend its support to Burundi, so that the\r
#Text=capacity-building programme for good governance,\r
#Text=which includes transparency, proper management of\r
#Text=public affairs, democracy and respect for human rights,\r
#Text=might remain a priority.
#Text=A joint committee made up of\r
#Text=members of organizations from civil society and\r
#Text=Government should be set up to ensure follow-up in\r
#Text=the management of all national resources, including\r
#Text=resources granted by international organizations.
#Text=The\r
#Text=current quota of 30 per cent should, in fact, be raised to\r
#Text=50 per cent and be applied at the local level.
#Text=Civil\r
#Text=society should be considered an active partner in all\r
#Text=programmes and processes.
#Text=Concerning demobilization, disarmament,\r
#Text=reintegration and reinsertion (DDRR), we should note\r
#Text=that this process is slowly moving forward.
#Text=Among the\r
#Text=important challenges facing Burundi, we should give\r
#Text=special attention to the following: circulation of\r
#Text=weapons among the population, which is a source of\r
#Text=insecurity and constant tension, particularly for\r
#Text=women; victims, namely, ex-combatants and persons\r
#Text=who have been repatriated or displaced, primarily\r
#Text=women, have not yet received restitution and resort to\r
#Text=community conflict and violence; the recently\r
#Text=established National Commission for Land and Other\r
#Text=Property, which was welcomed by women.
#Text=Unfortunately, its functioning and the implementation\r
#Text=of its recommendations require not only mobilization\r
#Text=of substantial resources but also know-how and\r
#Text=experience in that field.
#Text=We firmly hope that the new\r
#Text=Peacebuilding Commission, established as part of\r
#Text=United Nations reform, will make support for the\r
#Text=National Commission Land and Other Property one of\r
#Text=its priorities.
#Text=The lack of programmes to help so-called\r
#Text=political prisoners who have been released adds to the\r
#Text=problem of insecurity.
#Text=Failure of the DDRR programme would\r
#Text=compromise achievements we have made towards\r
#Text=peace and democracy.
#Text=We recommend that the\r
#Text=international community continue to give its political,\r
#Text=technical and financial support to the Government of\r
#Text=Burundi, so that disarmament, reintegration and\r
#Text=reinsertion might become a reality on the ground.
#Text=The\r
#Text=international community should support civil society in\r
#Text=Burundi in its efforts to mobilize and promote\r
#Text=awareness among the population about the dangers of\r
#Text=possession and circulation of weapons in the\r
#Text=community and to promote voluntary disarmament.
#Text=A\r
#Text=similar programme could be carried out at the\r
#Text=subregional level.
#Text=Since the end of hostilities, poverty has continued\r
#Text=to increase in Burundi and is affecting, above all,\r
#Text=women, who cannot inherit land from their parents and\r
#Text=cannot gain title to their husband's land and property.
#Text=In addition to dependence, corruption and fraud are\r
#Text=exacerbating the status of women.
#Text=Women have always\r
#Text=asked that this be given priority in negotiations.
#Text=We recommend that the United Nations not hold\r
#Text=women hostage to the political situation in Burundi and\r
#Text=\r
#Text=that women be enabled to have direct access to\r
#Text=financing that allows them to undertake and\r
#Text=consolidate the work that they have been doing at the\r
#Text=grassroots level.
#Text=Funds allocated by the Peacebuilding\r
#Text=Commission should be used for that work.
#Text=The\r
#Text=Commission should ensure follow-up to the\r
#Text=implementation of a corruption and fraud focal point\r
#Text=that would ensure equitable distribution of public\r
#Text=property.
#Text=The focal point should also respect gender\r
#Text=parity.
#Text=As for human rights, it should be emphasized that\r
#Text=these challenges refer to basic aspects of human rights,\r
#Text=for which we would like to make several\r
#Text=recommendations in order to promote respect for those\r
#Text=rights.
#Text=Legislation for gender equality and equity\r
#Text=should be adopted and applied.
#Text=There should be an\r
#Text=independent national focal point for women's rights to\r
#Text=ensure implementation of commitments made by the\r
#Text=Government under national legislation and\r
#Text=international treaties ratified by Burundi.
#Text=There should\r
#Text=be an end to impunity through the establishment of\r
#Text=machinery for transitional justice to deal with rape and\r
#Text=murder.
#Text=That would require the reform and\r
#Text=modernization of the police and legal services, which\r
#Text=must be professional in spirit and directly accountable\r
#Text=to the people.
#Text=A trust fund should be established to\r
#Text=which Member States would contribute for at least five\r
#Text=years to enable women who are victims of sexual\r
#Text=violence and other abuses to have recourse to justice.
#Text=There should be support for organizations helping\r
#Text=women, in particular United Nations Development\r
#Text=Fund for Women, with material, financial and human\r
#Text=resources adequate to reach additional beneficiaries.
